page.title: 10Attitudes
page.content: A survey carried out by the pupils to test attitudes showed that the majority of people preferred country life to town life. Among the reasons given were fresh air, freedom and space. Although there are fewer facilities in the country, people prefer to travel to work, shop, and even follow leisure activities. Concern was expressed at the smaller number of farm jobs, which was forcing young people with families to leave the area and causing a decline in the school rolls. There was also concern about the decrease in bus services, and some dissatisfaction with the present system of local government compared with the former county councils.
